default: (a) a {@item chain shirt|phb} or (b) {@item studded leather armor|phb|studded leather}

(a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb|shields}, or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 {@item crossbow bolt|phb|bolts}, or (b) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}, (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}, or (c) a {@item scholar's pack|phb}

classFeature.name: Conduit of Arcana
entries: You have begun your journey towards mastery of martial magic, focusing your magical power through weapons and battle. You can use any weapon you are proficient with as a spellcasting focus, and you can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

A mixture of arcane research and natural spellcasting talent has turned you into a conduit of raw magic. You are able to channel your kinetic energy into arcana points, which allow you to conjure magical effects and cast spells.
This feature improves at 6th, 10th, 15th and 20th level.

classFeature.name: Arcana Points
entries: You have 2 arcana points, and you gain more as you reach higher levels as shown in the Arcana Points column of the Spellblade table. You regain all spent arcana points when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Flexible Casting
entries: You can use your arcana points to cast spells. To do so, you expend a number of arcana points to create a spell slot of a given level, and then use that slot to cast a spell. You can create spell slots no higher in level than 5th and must have spell slots of a level achieved in order to generate them in this way.

classFeature.name: Spellweaving Duelist
entries: Along with the skills of martial magic, you have studied the techniques at the core of the spellblade art: Eject, Sprint, and Parry. You must spend 2 arcana points to use these techniques. Once you have done so, you require a short or long rest to recharge this ability even if you have remaining arcana points. When you cast these spells with this technique, you do not require verbal or material components for the casting, do not expend a spell slot, and the spell has a range of self. You cannot use this technique while incapacitated or restrained.

entries.name: Eject
entries: As a bonus action, you cast the {@spell jump} spell and it lasts for 1 round.

entries.name: Sprint
entries: As a bonus action, you cast the {@spell longstrider} spell and it lasts for 1 minute.

entries.name: Parry
entries: You cast the {@spell shield} spell but cannot take a bonus action on your following turn.

classFeature.name: Displacement
entries: As a bonus action you may spend 2 arcana point to project an illusion that blurs your image by a few inches that follows your every movement, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are incapacitated, restrained, or otherwise unable to move. This effect lasts for 1 minute.
This feature improves further at 10th level.

classFeature.name: Arcane Strike
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with a melee attack, you may expend a spell slot to increase damage with your weapon attack. The bonus to damage is {@damage 2d6} for a 1st level spell slot, +{@damage 1d6} for every level above that to a max of {@damage 6d6} at 5th level. Alternatively, you may expend arcana points using the Flexible Casting table above.
When you gain this feature choose a damage type from the following list: Fire, Cold, Lighting, Thunder or Force.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You cannot take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to draw upon the ultimate tool for mastery of battle: magic. Some spellblades study arcane magic with scholars and wizards, while others practice their art in solitude, focus and meditation their only company. All spellblades understand the delicate balance between mind, magic, and blade, a balance one must strike if they wish to master the art of spellweaving.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the spellblade spell list. You learn additional cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Spellblade table.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: The Spells Known column of the Spellblade table shows when you learn more spellblade spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the spellblade spells you know and replace it with another spell from the spellblade spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: he Spellblade table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. If you instead cast a spell using arcana points, you no longer expend a spell slot but may cast a spell only if you spend the necessary arcana points. You may cast a spell at a higher level without expending a spell slot if you spend the necessary arcana points. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell absorb elements} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell absorb elements} using either slot.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your spellblade spells, as your mental tenacity is what allows you to wield magic. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spellblade spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

classFeature.name: Arcane Discipline
entries: You choose the discipline that defines your style of martial magic: Breaker, Warden, or Tactician. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Unwavering Focus
entries: You can maintain your focus in the most tumultuous of situations. You have a +2 to Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell when you take damage.

classFeature.name: Blink
entries: As a bonus action you may spend 2 arcana points to teleport to an unoccupied space up to 15 ft. in any direction that you can see. Doing so preserves your momentum and orientation.
This feature improves at 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Glyph Sense
entries: Your senses have attuned to the energies of magic in the world around you, warding you against potential danger. You can sense glyphs or magical traps with your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) or with a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check as an action. When using a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check, you can pinpoint hidden glyphs or magical traps within 10 feet.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Desperate Insight
entries: You may spend an arcana point to gain a +6 bonus on a skill check that you do not have proficiency in.

classFeature.name: Conduit of Arcana Improvement
entries: You can spend 1 arcana point and choose to cast a cantrip you know with a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action. You can do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, regaining all expended uses of this ability after completing a long rest.

classFeature.name: Arcane Discipline Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Arcane Discipline.

classFeature.name: Gravity Bend
entries: As a bonus action you may spend 3 arcana points to have gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. While climbing in this way, you need only use your feet to climb walls and surfaces, leaving your hands free (as {@spell spider climb}).
These effects last for 10 minutes and does not require {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Refined Spellweaving Duelist
entries: Hours of practice and meditation have honed your technique to a fine edge. Your basic spellweaving techniques (Eject, Sprint, Parry) now cost 1 arcana point. Additionally, whenever you use the Eject or Sprint spellweaving techniques with arcana points, you may gain the benefits of both techniques simultaneously at the cost of 1 additional arcana point (2 total). You may also use the ability twice (both or one cast) between every short rest.
Additionally, you gain a new spellweaving technique from the list below, which you add to your list of known techniques.

entries.name: Spellblade's Flurry
entries: When casting a spell of 1st or 2nd level that has a casting time of 1 action, you can instead cast the spell as a bonus action.

entries.name: Find an Opening
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose to gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Reactive Wit
entries: As a reaction to taking acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, psychic, or force damage, you gain resistance to that type of damage, including the triggering damage, for 1 minute.

entries.name: Perfect Focus
entries: As a bonus action, you gain advantage on saving throws and ability checks in one ability score of your choice for 1 minute. You may only have this active on one ability score at a time.

classFeature.name: Arcane Discipline Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Arcane Discipline.

classFeature.name: Conduit of Arcana Improvement
entries: You gain an additional charge on your 6th level Conduit of Arcana Improvement feature.

classFeature.name: Displacement Improvement
entries: If you spend 2 additional points upon activating your Displacement feature, it remains active even when you take damage.

classFeature.name: Blurred Alacrity
entries: As a bonus action you may spend 3 arcana points causing your subsequent movement to not provoke attacks of opportunity. This effect last for 1 minute.
Additionally, if you take damage that would reduce you to 0 or fewer hit points, you can spend 4 arcana points as a reaction to ignore the damage. You may use this ability once per day.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Arcane Discipline Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Arcane Discipline.

classFeature.name: Blink Improvement
entries: You may instead use your Blink feature as a reaction at the cost of 3 arcana points.

classFeature.name: Reflect
entries: Your prowess with defensive magic has become so refined that it is now an offense. Whenever you are targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, you can attempt to reflect the spell back at the caster as a reaction by expending a spell slot. When you do so, you must use a spell slot of an equal or higher level to the spell being cast, otherwise you do not affect the spell and your spell slot is wasted. You must also be holding a spellcasting focus, and be able to perform the somatic components of a spell.

If you are able to use a spell slot of equal or higher level, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC for this ability check is equal to 20 - the spell slot level you expended. On a successful check, the spell is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from you, turning the caster into the target. On a failed check, the spell is unaffected.

classFeature.name: Conduit of Arcana Improvement
entries: You gain an additional charge on your 6th level Conduit of Arcana Improvement feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Perfected Spellweaving Duelist
entries: You have mastered the art of arcane techniques, focusing your martial magic into extraordinary feats of power. When you use your Parry technique to cast shield, your AC increases by 10 instead of 5. The Arcane Technique you chose at 8th level also improves, as shown below.

entries.name: Spellblade's Flurry
entries: When casting a spell of 1st or 2nd level that has a casting time of 1 action, you can instead cast the spell as a reaction.

entries.name: Find an Opening
entries: As a bonus action, you have advantage on all melee weapon attacks for your Intelligence modifier in rounds.

entries.name: Reactive Wit
entries: You gain immunity instead of resistance to the triggering damage type for 1 minute.

entries.name: Perfect Focus
entries: As a reaction, you gain advantage on a saving throw or ability check for two ability scores of your choice for 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Conduit of Arcana Improvement
entries: You gain an additional charge on your 6th level Conduit of Arcana Improvement feature.

classFeature.name: Equilibrium
entries: You fight with the serenity of a master spellblade. You regain your ability to use a Spellweaving Duelist technique after you roll for initiative.
Additionally, whenever you attempt to reflect a spell with your Reflect ability, you no longer waste a spell slot if you fail the attempt.

subclassFeature.name: Breaker
entries: The Breaker is the spellblade that uses the blade as an extension of his body; augmenting attacks with explosive magic, being highly disruptive and unpredictable. Those who study this discipline are often headstrong and quick to act, favoring the tactic of hitting first, and asking questions later.

subclassFeature.name: Armscasting
entries: You extend your magical understanding through your mastery at arms. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to expend 3 arcana points and cast a spell that requires a ranged spell attack. When you cast a spell in this way, you make an additional ranged spell attack and expend a spell slot as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Crackling Edge
entries: You may spend 3, 5, or 7 arcana points to channel arcana energy into your weapon, causing it to become magical for 1 minute. During this time it functions as a +1, +2, or +3 weapon respectively. If you are disarmed or sheathe your weapon you lose this bonus. This effect does not stack with itself or other magical properties on a weapon -- the highest benefit is taken. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Bladeblink
entries: You can channel the kinetic energy of your strikes into your melee weapon and propel it at foes for surprise damage. When taking the {@action Attack} action and hitting a creature with a melee attack, you may spend 1 arcana point to then throw your melee weapon making a ranged weapon attack at a creature that you can see within 30 feet. If the attack hits, the weapon sticks to the creature dealing its normal damage plus {@damage 2d6} force. This ranged weapon attack uses your Extra Attack feature. If the attack misses, the weapon teleports back to an open hand instantly.

Additionally, you may spend 2 more arcana points you may then teleport (as {@spell misty step}) to your weapon provided there is space for you to appear next to the struck creature and draw your weapon. If you choose not to teleport, the weapon returns to an open hand at the end of your {@action Attack} action.

subclassFeature.name: Spelljam
entries: Your reflexes have sharpened to a perfect edge and can interrupt spellcasting as it is uttered. As a reaction, you may finish the verbal component of a wizard, sorcerer, warlock or bard spell as it is being said by a caster that you can hear, understand and see within 90 feet. Make an Arcana check DC 14 + the spell's level.
If you fail, you can attempt the saving throw of the spell (if it has one and you are the target) with advantage, or gain +5 AC if it is a ranged spell attack.

If you succeed, you may spend 3 + half the spell's level arcana points to cast the spell yourself at half range, radius and damage. If the spell has a range of self, you are the target. If the spell must be saved against, it becomes your spell save DC -2.
In addition to casting the stolen spell, if you succeed by 5 or more, the spell fizzles as if counterspell was cast.
This technique is difficult and exhausting and can only be attempted twice per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Warden
entries: The Warden is the spellblade that uses force shields as an extension of his body; augmenting defense with deflecting magic, being careful and protecting others from harm. Those who study this discipline are often measured and thorough, favoring the tactic of outlasting their enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Projected Barrier
entries: You may extend your {@spell shield} spell to a creature that you can see within 15 ft as a reaction. The spell is otherwise cast normally requiring spell slots or arcana points -- you may cast this by using your Parry technique.
In addition, you may use your Parry technique of Spellweaving Duelist twice per long rest and no longer lose your bonus action on the following turn.

subclassFeature.name: Contingency
entries: You may target up to 6 creatures that you can see within 10 feet and draw a Contingency ward on them, each as an action. The creature must be living and accept the ward. For each creature targeted you must spend 1 arcana point. A creature warded with Contingency may expend the arcane energy and conjure a {@spell shield} spell normally (as a reaction). This otherwise does not expend a spell slot or require components. The ward lasts until expended or the end of a long rest.
This feature improves at 9th, 12th and 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Contingency Improvement
entries: Your Contingency ward manifests additional forms of protection. A creature warded with Contingency may instead expend the ward as a reaction to gain advantage on a Dexterity saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Missile Halt
entries: You can lock a projectile in flight giving time for the target to make its escape. As an reaction, you may expend 3 arcana points to target a moving projectile that you can see with a Halt ward, causing it to lock in place and halting all momentum. In addition, you must make an Arcana check to safely release the ward.
If the projectile is fired as a projectile weapon (sling, bow, crossbow, etc.) the DC is 8 + the Dexterity modifier of the attacker.
If the projectile is a spell, the DC is 11 + the spell level.
If the projectile is large (boulder, falling rubble, etc.) the DC is 15.
Anything larger than Huge size category (or otherwise significantly massive) cannot be halted.

Failure causes the intended target of the projectile to gain a +2 bonus against the projectile (+2 Dexterity saving throw or AC). Failure by 5 or more means the Halt fails and the projectile travels unimpeded and at the intended target.

On a success, the attack misses, the target automatically succeeds its Dexterity saving throw (if not {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} or {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}) or the object falls directly downward harmlessly and comes to rest connecting with a surface or object that can hold it.

subclassFeature.name: Contingency Improvement
entries: The arcana points required to use your Contingency feature is halved (rounded down). For example, 5 targets would require 2 arcana points total.

subclassFeature.name: Diamond Skin
entries: Your understanding of force barriers becomes second nature and you are gripped in an aura of deflection. You gain resistance to force damage. Additionally, as a reaction you may expend 3 arcana points when you suffer force damage and reflect it back at the attacker, dealing half of the spell damage back to the caster.
This feature improves at 17th and 20th level.

subclassFeature.name: Contingency Improvement
entries: Each Contingency ward has two charges.

subclassFeature.name: Diamond Skin Improvement
entries: You may apply the Diamond Skin property to the subject of one of your Contingency wards. The ward is expended as normal, though they cannot reflect force damage unless they are also a Warden Spellblade of sufficient level.

subclassFeature.name: Diamond Skin Improvement
entries: You become immune to force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tactician
entries: The Tactician is the spellblade that uses the battlefield as an extension of his body; controlling the flow of combat, being prepared for whatever the enemies may throw at him and relying of his allies to achieve victory. Those who study this discipline are often calculating and natural leaders, favoring the tactic of crushing their enemies with one unified battle unit.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Calculation
entries: You have sharpened your senses and are unmatched on the battlefield. After initiative has been determined, you may augment the speed of an ally you can see within 30 feet and they act first. You may only augment one target per round. You may only do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier each day and recharges on a long rest.
This feature improves at 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Peerless Commander
entries: You can use your tactical knowledge to issue commands to your allies and bolster your forces with your arcane prowess. As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 1 arcana point and issue an Order to one creature, other than yourself, within 30 feet that can see and hear you. When you issue an Order, choose from the options detailed below.

entries.name: Attack Order
entries: Your Order emboldens an ally to take the offensive and accelerate their attacks with ferocious force. The next time the creature targeted by this Order takes the {@action Attack} action before the start of your next turn, they can add your Intelligence modifier to the attack roll and {@damage 2d4} force damage to the damage roll for one attack.

entries.name: Defensive Order
entries: Your Order instructs your ally to dodge incoming attacks . Until the start of your next turn, the creature targeted by this Order gains a bonus to their Armor Class equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). If attacked and the attack misses, the attacker suffers {@damage 2d4} force damage.

entries.name: Rallying Order
entries: Your Order provides strategic insight to an ally moving about the battlefield and protects the ally from incoming threats. A creature targeted by this Order can use their reaction to immediately move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. For every opportunity attack that would have been provoked, the ally Ordered gains {@dice 2d4} temporary hit points (maximum of {@dice 6d4}).

entries.name: Steadfast Order
entries: Your Order inspires creatures to stand their ground and give no quarter. A creature targeted by this Order can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to any Strength or Constitution checks or saving throws they make before the start of your next turn.
This feature improves at 9th level.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Calculation Improvement
entries: You cannot be surprised while you are conscious and when you roll initiative at the start of combat, you can immediately take the Ready action regardless of your initiative.

subclassFeature.name: Peerless Commander Improvement
entries: Your experience as a leader on the battlefield allows you to command multiple allies. When you issue an Order, you can issue the same order to one additional creature within 30 feet that can see and hear you, expending an additional arcana point.

subclassFeature.name: INCOMING!
entries: Your constant vigilance grants you a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score and advantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks you make. You can see danger coming from a mile away and are not deterred. You gain immunity to {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition.

In addition, your ability to respond to dangerous situations is unparalleled. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw you can spend 3 arcana points to succeed instead. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
This feature improves at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Warcry
entries: Your presence on the battlefield inspires heroic action in those who fight alongside you. You can rally your allies. As an action on your turn, you can yell out a rallying cry, all allies within 60 feet of you can use their reaction to join in your rally. When you do so, you an all allies that joined in the rallying cry gain the following benefits until the start of your next turn:

All effected creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Spellblade level, +2 to their AC and saving throws and +2 to their attack rolls and +1 spell save DC for rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1). You may spend 6 arcana points to extend this Warcry to 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
In addition, when you issue an Order you can issue the same Order to one additional creature (3 creatures total).

subclassFeature.name: INCOMING! Improvement
entries: You may call out to an ally that can hear you within 60 feet. If they fail a Dexterity saving throw you may spend 3 arcana points as a reaction and the ally can choose to succeed instead. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
